bibl.title: Letter fragment from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, December 17, 1907

div1.p: Von Mansfelde writes that he is working to increase Mabel Lazear's pension.

div1.head: Letter fragment from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, December 17, 1907
div1.opener:
Nebraska State Medical Association
A. S. v. Mansfrede, M. D., Treasurer
“Quality Bill.” Ashland, Nebraska
{Fort Wayne} Indiana
December 17th 1907.
Dear Mrs Lazear:
div1.p:
My daughter Duty has forwarded
your letter of recent date to me. Is it possible
that I could have forgotten the receipt of
your husbands picture, frame and all and
not have mentioned it in the next letter?
However I hasten to make good this apparent
neglect on my past by saying thank you
now, or again.

What do you suppose is going to
happen tonight? After 44 years, when the
poor emigrant German boy commenced
his medical career in this City, he is to
address the profession and the public- in
the Courthouse by invitation upon the theme
nearest to his heart at present: Lazear
and Carroll, heroes and martyrs!

ington that the bills are introduced in
